Text: I appreciate the upload, but seriously, what's the point of splitting the file into 19 RAR files? Putting the AVI into a RAR didn't even save one single byte of file size, so it's obviously not going to speed up file size.  I just don't see why people do this... it only adds an unnecessary step in the process.  Just upload the AVI and you'll have instant playback abilities.

It's split into rar's so that if a file downloads wrong you can redownload the bad part.  Unlike an avi where you're fucked redownloading the whole avi file again.  It's probably not as necessary for a sub 400 meg file, but for 4 gig movies it's appreciated.
if you dont like it dont download it, really, do you think anyone else wants to read you useless waffle?
